sense.def: Alternative Names shizhu 屍注 , corpse [qi] influx. Pathological Condition identical with gui zhu 鬼疰 , demon attachment-illness. San yin ji yi bing zheng fang lun 三因極一病證方論 10: 夫 骨蒸、殗殜、復連、屍疰、勞疰、蟲疰、毒疰、熱疰、冷疰、食疰、鬼 疰等，皆曰傳屍者，以疰者、注也，病自上注下，與前人相似，故曰疰 , “Bone steaming, an early mild stage of corpse transmission, repeated connection, corpse [qi] attachment-illness , exhaustion attachment-illness, bug attachment-illness, poison attachment-illness, heat attachment-illness, cold attachment-illness, food attachment-illness, and demon attachment-illness, they all are variants of corpse [qi] transmission. The character zhu 疰 is to say zhu 注 , ‘to flow’. The disease flows from one generation to the next. Its appearance is similar to that of the previous [afflicted] person. Hence it is called zhu 疰 , ‘influx-illness’”. With the character zhu 疰 identified here as a combination of the radical ni 疒 signifying “illness” with the component zhu 主 of zhu 注 , the term shi zhu 屍疰 may also be interpreted/translated as “corpse [qi] influx-illness”.
